trans-unit.source: Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree
trans-unit.target: Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree

trans-unit.source: Creates a binary classifier using a boosted decision tree algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classifier using a boosted decision tree algorithm

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> module to create a machine learning model that is based on the boosted decision trees algorithm.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> module to create a machine learning model that is based on the boosted decision trees algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Generally, when properly configured, boosted decision trees are the easiest methods with which to get top performance on a wide variety of machine learning tasks.
trans-unit.target: Generally, when properly configured, boosted decision trees are the easiest methods with which to get top performance on a wide variety of machine learning tasks.

trans-unit.source: However, they are also one of the more memory-intensive learners, and the current implementation holds everything in memory; therefore, a boosted decision tree model might not be able to process the very large datasets that some linear learners can handle.
trans-unit.target: However, they are also one of the more memory-intensive learners, and the current implementation holds everything in memory; therefore, a boosted decision tree model might not be able to process the very large datasets that some linear learners can handle.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to choose an algorithm, see these resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to choose an algorithm, see these resources:

trans-unit.source: Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for clustering, classification, or regression
trans-unit.target: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for clustering, classification, or regression

trans-unit.source: Classification is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.
trans-unit.target: Classification is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.

trans-unit.source: You can train the model by providing the boosted decision tree model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can train the model by providing the boosted decision tree model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Boosted Tree Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Boosted Tree Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the decision tree model, such as the number of trees and learning rate.
trans-unit.target: Continue to set other parameters that affect the behavior of the decision tree model, such as the number of trees and learning rate.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the behavior of the boosted decision trees classifier by using these parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the behavior of the boosted decision trees classifier by using these parameters:

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of leaves per tree
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of leaves per tree

trans-unit.source: Type a number to constrain the number of terminal nodes (leaves) in any tree.
trans-unit.target: Type a number to constrain the number of terminal nodes (leaves) in any tree.

trans-unit.source: By increasing this value, you potentially increase the size of the tree and get better precision, at the risk of overfitting and longer training time.
trans-unit.target: By increasing this value, you potentially increase the size of the tree and get better precision, at the risk of overfitting and longer training time.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of samples per leaf node
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of samples per leaf node

trans-unit.source: Type a number to specify the minimum number of cases required to create any terminal node (leaf) in a tree.
trans-unit.target: Type a number to specify the minimum number of cases required to create any terminal node (leaf) in a tree.

trans-unit.source: By increasing this value, you increase the threshold for creating new rules.
trans-unit.target: By increasing this value, you increase the threshold for creating new rules.

trans-unit.source: For example, with the default value of 1, even a single case can cause a new rule to be created.
trans-unit.target: For example, with the default value of 1, even a single case can cause a new rule to be created.

trans-unit.source: If you increase the value to 5, the training data would have to contain at least 5 cases that meet the same conditions.
trans-unit.target: If you increase the value to 5, the training data would have to contain at least 5 cases that meet the same conditions.

trans-unit.source: Learning rate
trans-unit.target: Learning rate

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the step size while learning.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the step size while learning.

trans-unit.source: This parameter determines how fast or slow the learner converges on the optimal solution.
trans-unit.target: This parameter determines how fast or slow the learner converges on the optimal solution.

trans-unit.source: If the learning rate (or step size) is too big you might overshoot the optimal solution.
trans-unit.target: If the learning rate (or step size) is too big you might overshoot the optimal solution.

trans-unit.source: If the learning rate is too small, training takes longer to converge on the best solution.
trans-unit.target: If the learning rate is too small, training takes longer to converge on the best solution.

trans-unit.source: Number of trees constructed
trans-unit.target: Number of trees constructed

trans-unit.source: Configure the maximum number of decision trees that can be created in the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: Configure the maximum number of decision trees that can be created in the ensemble.

trans-unit.source: By creating more decision trees, you can potentially get better coverage, but training time will increase.
trans-unit.target: By creating more decision trees, you can potentially get better coverage, but training time will increase.

trans-unit.source: Random number seed
trans-unit.target: Random number seed

trans-unit.source: Optionally, type a non-negative integer to use as the random seed value.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, type a non-negative integer to use as the random seed value.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a seed ensures reproducibility across runs that have the same data and parameters.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a seed ensures reproducibility across runs that have the same data and parameters.

trans-unit.source: The random seed is set by default to 0, which means the initial seed value is obtained from the system clock.
trans-unit.target: The random seed is set by default to 0, which means the initial seed value is obtained from the system clock.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: Select this option to create a group for unknown values in the training and validation sets.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to create a group for unknown values in the training and validation sets.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: In general, boosted decision trees yield better results when features are somewhat related.
trans-unit.target: In general, boosted decision trees yield better results when features are somewhat related.

trans-unit.source: If features have a large degree of entropy (that is, they are not related), they share little or no mutual information, and ordering them in a tree will not yield a lot of predictive significance.
trans-unit.target: If features have a large degree of entropy (that is, they are not related), they share little or no mutual information, and ordering them in a tree will not yield a lot of predictive significance.

trans-unit.source: Generally, boosting works well when you have many more examples than features because the model is prone to overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Generally, boosting works well when you have many more examples than features because the model is prone to overfitting.

trans-unit.source: If you have missing values in your data, add indicators for appropriate features.
trans-unit.target: If you have missing values in your data, add indicators for appropriate features.

trans-unit.source: Because the treatment of features is a simple, non-parametric, less-than/greater-than comparison, normalization or any form of non-monotonic transformation function will have little effect.
trans-unit.target: Because the treatment of features is a simple, non-parametric, less-than/greater-than comparison, normalization or any form of non-monotonic transformation function will have little effect.

trans-unit.source: (It can possibly lead to the choice of different bins, which is effectively random.)
trans-unit.target: (It can possibly lead to the choice of different bins, which is effectively random.)

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how boosted decision trees are used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how boosted decision trees are used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to predict customer appetency.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to predict customer appetency.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to determine whether a flight is likely to be delayed.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to determine whether a flight is likely to be delayed.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Credit card risk</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525270</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to predict risk.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Credit card risk</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525270</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <ui>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree</ui> algorithm to predict risk.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: To train a boosted decision tree model, you must provide multiple data instances—that is, more than one row.
trans-unit.target: To train a boosted decision tree model, you must provide multiple data instances—that is, more than one row.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about the boosted decision tree algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>Greedy Function Approximation: A Gradient Boosting Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://www-stat.stanford.edu/~jhf/ftp/trebst.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about the boosted decision tree algorithm, see <externalLink><linkText>Greedy Function Approximation: A Gradient Boosting Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://www-stat.stanford.edu/~jhf/ftp/trebst.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The boosted decision tree algorithm in Azure Machine Learning uses the following boosting method:
trans-unit.target: The boosted decision tree algorithm in Azure Machine Learning uses the following boosting method:

trans-unit.source: Start with an empty ensemble of weak learners.
trans-unit.target: Start with an empty ensemble of weak learners.

trans-unit.source: For each training example, get the current output of the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: For each training example, get the current output of the ensemble.

trans-unit.source: (This is the sum of the outputs of all weak learners in the ensemble.)
trans-unit.target: (This is the sum of the outputs of all weak learners in the ensemble.)

trans-unit.source: Calculate the gradient of the loss function (problem dependent) for each example.
trans-unit.target: Calculate the gradient of the loss function (problem dependent) for each example.

trans-unit.source: Use the example to fit a weak learner by using that gradient as the target function.
trans-unit.target: Use the example to fit a weak learner by using that gradient as the target function.

trans-unit.source: Add that weak learner to the ensemble with a strength indicated by the learning rate, and if desired, go to Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Add that weak learner to the ensemble with a strength indicated by the learning rate, and if desired, go to Step 2.

trans-unit.source: The implementations are identical up to the gradient of the loss, which depends on whether the task is a binary classification problem or a regression problem.
trans-unit.target: The implementations are identical up to the gradient of the loss, which depends on whether the task is a binary classification problem or a regression problem.

trans-unit.source: In a binary classification model, the log-loss is used, much like in logistic regression.
trans-unit.target: In a binary classification model, the log-loss is used, much like in logistic regression.

trans-unit.source: In a <legacyLink xlink:href="0207d252-6c41-4c77-84c3-73bdf1ac5960" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">regression</legacyLink> model, the squared loss is used, and the gradient is the current output, minus the target).
trans-unit.target: In a <legacyLink xlink:href="0207d252-6c41-4c77-84c3-73bdf1ac5960" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">regression</legacyLink> model, the squared loss is used, and the gradient is the current output, minus the target).

trans-unit.source: The weak learners in this implementation are the least-squares regression trees, which use the gradients calculated in Step 3 as the target.
trans-unit.target: The weak learners in this implementation are the least-squares regression trees, which use the gradients calculated in Step 3 as the target.

trans-unit.source: The trees are subject to the following restrictions:
trans-unit.target: The trees are subject to the following restrictions:

trans-unit.source: They are trained up to a maximum number of leaves.
trans-unit.target: They are trained up to a maximum number of leaves.

trans-unit.source: Each leaf has a minimum number of examples to guard against overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Each leaf has a minimum number of examples to guard against overfitting.

trans-unit.source: Each decision node is a single feature that is compared against some threshold.
trans-unit.target: Each decision node is a single feature that is compared against some threshold.

trans-unit.source: If that feature is less than or equal to the threshold, it goes down one path, and if it is greater than the threshold, it goes down the other path.
trans-unit.target: If that feature is less than or equal to the threshold, it goes down one path, and if it is greater than the threshold, it goes down the other path.

trans-unit.source: Each leaf node is a constant value.
trans-unit.target: Each leaf node is a constant value.

trans-unit.source: The tree-building algorithm greedily selects the feature and threshold for which a split will most decrease the squared loss with regard to the gradient calculated in Step 3.
trans-unit.target: The tree-building algorithm greedily selects the feature and threshold for which a split will most decrease the squared loss with regard to the gradient calculated in Step 3.

trans-unit.source: It is subject to a minimum number of training examples per leaf.
trans-unit.target: It is subject to a minimum number of training examples per leaf.

trans-unit.source: It repeatedly splits until it reaches the maximum number of leaves, or until no valid split is available.
trans-unit.target: It repeatedly splits until it reaches the maximum number of leaves, or until no valid split is available.

trans-unit.source: Features are discretized and binned prior to training, so only a relatively small set of threshold candidates are considered, even for continuous features.
trans-unit.target: Features are discretized and binned prior to training, so only a relatively small set of threshold candidates are considered, even for continuous features.

trans-unit.source: Leave it blank for the default.
trans-unit.target: Leave it blank for the default.

trans-unit.source: If True, an additional level is created for each categorical column.
trans-unit.target: If True, an additional level is created for each categorical column.

trans-unit.source: Any levels in the test dataset that are not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
trans-unit.target: Any levels in the test dataset that are not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.

trans-unit.target: Untrained model

trans-unit.source: An untrained binary classification model
trans-unit.target: An untrained binary classification model
